verses.kjv: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he went not, as at other times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
verses.web: When Balaam saw that it pleased LORD to bless Israel, he didn’t go, as at the other times, to use divination, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
verses.ct: When Balaam realized that the LORD was determined to bless Israel, he didn't go off to seek omens as he had done before. Instead, he turned and faced the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel abiding in his tents according to their tribes; and the spirit of God came upon him.
verses.web: Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to their tribes; and the Spirit of God came on him.
verses.ct: Balaam looked up and saw Israel spread out below, camped tribe by tribe. Then the spirit of God came upon him.

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:
verses.web: He took up his parable, and said, “Balaam the son of Beor says, the man whose eyes are open says;
verses.ct: He spoke this prophecy: "This is the declaration of Balaam son of Beor — the man whose eyes have been opened speaks:

verses.kjv: He hath said, which heard the words of God, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
verses.web: he says, who hears the words of God, who sees the vision of the Almighty, falling down, and having his eyes open:
verses.ct: The one who hears the words of God speaks, the one who sees visions from the Almighty, falling into a trance with his eyes wide open:

verses.kjv: How goodly are thy tents, O Jacob, and thy tabernacles, O Israel!
verses.web: How goodly are your tents, Jacob, and your dwellings, Israel!
verses.ct: How beautiful are your tents, Jacob — your dwelling places, Israel!

verses.kjv: As the valleys are they spread forth, as gardens by the river’s side, as the trees of lign aloes which the LORD hath planted, and as cedar trees beside the waters.
verses.web: As valleys they are spread out, as gardens by the riverside, as aloes which LORD has planted, as cedar trees beside the waters.
verses.ct: They stretch out like valleys, like gardens along a river, like aloe trees the LORD has planted, like cedars growing beside the water.

verses.kjv: He shall pour the water out of his buckets, and his seed shall be in many waters, and his king shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.web: Water shall flow from his buckets. His seed shall be in many waters. His king shall be higher than Agag. His kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.ct: Water will overflow from his buckets, and his descendants will thrive like crops beside abundant streams. His king will rise higher than Agag, and his kingdom will be exalted.

verses.kjv: God brought him forth out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nations his enemies, and shall break their bones, and pierce them through with his arrows.
verses.web: God brings him out of Egypt. He has as it were the strength of the wild ox. He shall consume the nations his adversaries, shall break their bones in pieces, and pierce them with his arrows.
verses.ct: God brought him out of Egypt. He has the strength of a wild ox. He will devour the nations that oppose him, crush their bones, and pierce them through with his arrows.

verses.kjv: He couched, he lay down as a lion, and as a great lion: who shall stir him up? Blessed is he that blesseth thee, and cursed is he that curseth thee.
verses.web: He couched, he lay down as a lion, as a lioness; who shall rouse him up? Everyone who blesses you is blessed. Everyone who curses you is cursed.”
verses.ct: He crouches and lies down like a lion — like a great lioness. Who dares to rouse him? Anyone who blesses you will be blessed, and anyone who curses you will be cursed."

verses.kjv: And Balak’s anger was kindled against Balaam, and he smote his hands together: and Balak said unto Balaam, I called thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed them these three times.
verses.web: Balak’s anger burned against Balaam, and he struck his hands together. Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, and, behold, you have altogether blessed them these three times.
verses.ct: Balak was furious with Balaam. He slammed his hands together and said, "I brought you here to curse my enemies, and instead you've blessed them — 3 times now!

verses.kjv: Therefore now flee thou to thy place: I thought to promote thee unto great honour; but, lo, the LORD hath kept thee back from honour.
verses.web: Therefore, flee to your place, now! I thought to promote you to great honor; but, behold, LORD has kept you back from honor.”
verses.ct: Get out of here! Go home! I planned to reward you generously, but the LORD has robbed you of that honor."

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Spake I not also to thy messengers which thou sentest unto me, saying,
verses.web: Balaam said to Balak, “Didn’t I also tell your messengers whom you sent to me, saying,
verses.ct: Balaam replied, "Didn't I tell the messengers you sent to me,

verses.kjv: If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the LORD, to do either good or bad of mine own mind; but what the LORD saith, that will I speak?
verses.web: ‘If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can’t go beyond LORD’s word, to do either good or bad from my own mind. I will say what LORD says’?
verses.ct: 'Even if Balak gave me his entire palace filled with silver and gold, I couldn't go against the LORD's command and do anything on my own — whether good or bad. I can only speak what the LORD tells me'?

verses.kjv: And now, behold, I go unto my people: come therefore, and I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.
verses.web: Now, behold, I go to my people. Come, I will inform you what this people shall do to your people in the latter days.”
verses.ct: Now I'm heading back to my own people. But before I go, let me warn you about what this people will do to your people in the days to come."

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:
verses.web: He took up his parable, and said, “Balaam the son of Beor says, the man whose eyes are open says;
verses.ct: Then he spoke this prophecy: "This is the declaration of Balaam son of Beor — the man whose eyes have been opened speaks:

verses.kjv: He hath said, which heard the words of God, and knew the knowledge of the most High, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
verses.web: he says, who hears the words of God, knows the knowledge of the Most High, and who sees the vision of the Almighty, Falling down, and having his eyes open:
verses.ct: The one who hears the words of God speaks, the one who possesses knowledge from the Most High, who sees visions from the Almighty, falling into a trance with his eyes wide open:

verses.kjv: I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite the corners of Moab, and destroy all the children of Sheth.
verses.web: I see him, but not now. I see him, but not near. A star will come out of Jacob. A scepter will rise out of Israel, and shall strike through the corners of Moab, and crush all the sons of Sheth.
verses.ct: I see him, but not in the present. I gaze at him, but he is not near. A star will rise from Jacob, and a scepter will emerge from Israel. He will crush the leaders of Moab and destroy all the sons of Sheth.

verses.kjv: And Edom shall be a possession, Seir also shall be a possession for his enemies; and Israel shall do valiantly.
verses.web: Edom shall be a possession. Seir, his enemies, also shall be a possession, while Israel does valiantly.
verses.ct: Edom will be conquered. Seir — his enemy's land — will become his possession, while Israel marches forward in triumph.

verses.kjv: Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city.
verses.web: Out of Jacob shall one have dominion, and shall destroy the remnant from the city.”
verses.ct: A ruler will come from Jacob and destroy every survivor in the city."

verses.kjv: And when he looked on Amalek, he took up his parable, and said, Amalek was the first of the nations; but his latter end shall be that he perish for ever.
verses.web: He looked at Amalek, and took up his parable, and said, “Amalek was the first of the nations, But his latter end shall come to destruction.”
verses.ct: Then Balaam looked toward Amalek and spoke this prophecy: "Amalek was the first among the nations, but in the end, he will be destroyed forever."

verses.kjv: And he looked on the Kenites, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwellingplace, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.
verses.web: He looked at the Kenite, and took up his parable, and said, “Your dwelling place is strong. Your nest is set in the rock.
verses.ct: Next he looked toward the Kenites and spoke this prophecy: "Your home seems secure — your nest is built high in the rock.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.
verses.web: Nevertheless Kain shall be wasted, until Asshur carries you away captive.”
verses.ct: But even so, the Kenites will be devastated, until Asshur carries you away as captives."

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God doeth this!
verses.web: He took up his parable, and said, “Alas, who shall live when God does this?
verses.ct: He spoke yet another prophecy: "Who can possibly survive when God does this?

verses.kjv: And ships shall come from the coast of Chittim, and shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and he also shall perish for ever.
verses.web: But ships shall come from the coast of Kittim. They shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber. He also shall come to destruction.”
verses.ct: Ships will come from the shores of Chittim. They will bring suffering to Asshur and suffering to Eber, but they too will be destroyed forever."

verses.kjv: And Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.
verses.web: Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place; and Balak also went his way.
verses.ct: After this, Balaam got up and returned home, and Balak went on his way.
